page.title: 03The Police Station
page.content: The{Police Station of Williton}was built in 1858 and is still in use today. It is based in Bank Street. The{Somerset Constabulary}was formed in 1856 and by 1857 had 260 men. The pay in those days was 80 pence a week. The Williton Police Station when built had a{Court}inside and{stables for the horses. There was also a{house for the inspector on the end of the building. There were no{telephones } until 1904. The{magistrates}came to Court by{horse}and today the metal rings are still there in the front wall where they tied up the horses. They had small{sub stations}at Watchet, Kilve and Stogumber. In{1968 a motor patrol car}was based at Williton. At about the same time the Court was closed.
